note.p: Death: 66 Palace Gardens Terrace, Kensington (21 March 1884)

Career: Taught anatomy in Extra-mural school, Edinburgh (1831-1836); private Physician to the Duke of Nedford (1837-1839); Professor of Anatomy, University of Glasgow (1848-1877); resigned and settled in London (1877); edited the 7th, 8th and 9th editions of Quain's Anatomy
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1887 vol 42 pp xi-xxviii signed by W A
References: A H Sykes, 'Foster and Sharpey's Tour of Europe' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 47-52, plate
